decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to quickly and aggressively disrupt the opponent's strategy while also building up a strong board presence. It has a low mana curve and relies on cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Bauble to generate card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Tormod's Crypt to control the game and protect its key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to use its artifact synergies and aggressive strategy to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with key creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Entomb. It then uses Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring these creatures back onto the battlefield for powerful effects. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces and disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck aims to win by quickly reanimating powerful creatures and overwhelming the opponent with their devastating effects.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creature cards, then using reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield for a strong, explosive play. It also includes control elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while also having a backup win condition with cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent. The strategy revolves around efficient graveyard manipulation and explosive reanimation plays.

This UR aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan with permission spells. The deck utilizes aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, supported by efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat. The deck also includes a strong tempo package with cards like Daze and Stifle, allowing it to maintain control of the game while applying pressure. Overall, the deck aims to pressure the opponent's life total while disrupting their strategy, making it difficult for them to stabilize and come back.

The main goal of this Doomsday combo deck is to assemble the combo pieces necessary to win the game in a single turn, typically by resolving a Doomsday spell. The deck focuses on utilizing various tutor effects and efficient cantrips to quickly dig through the deck and find the necessary combo pieces, while also packing disruption in the form of counterspells and hand disruption to protect the combo. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Thassa's Oracle and Lion's Eye Diamond enables alternative win conditions and lines of play, providing versatility and adaptability in different game situations.

This deck aims to generate a large amount of mana quickly using cards like Dark Ritual, Mox Opal, and Lion's Eye Diamond, while also setting up card advantage with Brainstorm and Echo of Eons. The goal is to cast multiple spells in a single turn, building up storm count, and then finish the game with a lethal Tendrils of Agony or Galvanic Relay. The deck also includes ways to search for specific cards with Beseech the Mirror and Burning Wish, ensuring the combo pieces are available when needed.

The deck focuses on using reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to quickly bring powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield. It also includes disruption in the form of counter spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, as well as hand disruption with Thoughtseize. The deck aims to quickly assemble a powerful board state while disrupting the opponent's game plan, creating a strong combo strategy that can overwhelm the opponent in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The key concept of this deck is to maintain tempo and pressure on the opponent through aggressive plays with cards like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, while also providing card advantage and selection with cards like Mishra's Bauble and Brainstorm. Additionally, the deck has access to efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat, as well as land disruption with Wasteland. The overall strategy is to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by utilizing lands and spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up a powerful board presence. By using cards like Dark Depths, Urza's Saga, and Thespian's Stage, the deck aims to quickly generate threats that can overwhelm the opponent. With cards like Wasteland and Crop Rotation, the deck can disrupt the opponent's mana base and prevent them from executing their game plan effectively. Overall, the deck focuses on using lands and control spells to dominate the game and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill the library, then returning Thassa's Oracle with Dread Return to win the game. The deck includes disruption with Force of Will and interaction with Swords to Plowshares, while also utilizing card draw and manipulation with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. The mana base supports the combo pieces and includes utility lands like Urza's Saga. The strategy revolves around efficiently executing the combo and protecting it from disruption to secure the win.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, and then bring them back onto the battlefield for a strong and fast offensive strategy. It also includes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's game plan. The deck utilizes a mix of flying creatures like Brazen Borrower and Archon of Cruelty, along with powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, to pressure the opponent and quickly close out the game.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The key strategy is to efficiently bring back game-ending threats like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent from the graveyard, overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures that are difficult to deal with. Additionally, cards like Thoughtseize and Brazen Borrower provide further disruption and control options, making it difficult for the opponent to execute their own game plan effectively.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly discard powerful creatures into the graveyard using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bring them back onto the battlefield with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. This allows the player to cheat big threats into play early in the game, overwhelming their opponent with powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo and control the game, while card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder help to find key pieces of the combo.

The main focus of this deck is to rapidly empty your library and win the game by using the "Oops, All Spells!" combo. By utilizing cards like Dark Ritual, Lotus Petal, and Simian Spirit Guide, you can quickly cast a string of spells and creatures that will allow you to mill your entire deck and put into play Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the spot. This combo relies on speed and precision, requiring careful planning and resource management to execute successfully.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly lock down the opponent's mana base and prevent them from casting spells by utilizing cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void. The deck also aims to apply pressure using aggressive creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and finish the game with powerful cards like Fury and Sundering Eruption. Additionally, the deck includes cards like The One Ring and Urza's Saga to provide additional value and advantage. Overall, the deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while presenting a fast and aggressive threat.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent while disrupting the opponent with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck utilizes efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat to control the board and finish off opponents. Mishra's Bauble and Brainstorm provide card advantage and selection, while Wasteland and land disruption help to keep the opponent off balance. The deck aims to pressure opponents early and maintain tempo throughout the game to secure a fast victory.
